Protected Hezbollah: edit disputes [edit=sysop] (expires 00:00, 1 September 2007 (UTC))
/* Bombings, terrorism and kidnappings */ I've split the section in two to seperate the alleged (terrorist) actions that Hezbollah denies carrying, from the actions that Hezbollah is responsible for.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 152539883 by [[Special:Contributions/Count Iblis|Count Iblis]] ([[User talk:Count Iblis|talk]]) - Hezbollah doesn't deny the kidnapping of the two israeli soldiers
Hezbollah categorically denies being involved in these attacks (except missile attacks on Israel). There is no hard evidence for Hezbollah involvement.
/* Accusations of bombings, terrorism and kidnappings */ not only are they accused of bombings, terrorism, and kidnappings, but they themselves admit and are proud of these actions.
/* Terrorism or resistance? */ I don't think the question "Terrorism or resistance?" is appropriate here. The question is if Hezbollah is responsible for these actions (of which some are terrorism)
/* Militant actions */ Terrorism or resistance?
Militant actions:"considered to be responsible" supposes that it is more or less a fact that Hezbollah is responsible. But, except fot the rocket attacks responsibility for these action is dispute
/* Stance on what is a legitimate military target */ Targeting policy
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 152477122 by [[Special:Contributions/Tom harrison|Tom harrison]] ([[User talk:Tom harrison|talk]])
/* Militant actions */ Militancy and terror
We've been over this, [[WP:WTA]] is pretty clear. Describe the acts, tell why some consider it terrorism, do not make conclusions about the acts themselves
/* Militant actions */ Militancy and terrorism
The [[1983 Beirut barracks bombing]] certainly cannot unambiguously be called a terrorist attack. The US considers this to be a terrorist attack, but it was still an attack on a legal military target
/* Militant actions */ terrorist attacks
Revert POV. Not all these alledged militant actions are terrorism.
/* Militant actions */ s/militant actions/terrorism/; simplify
So now that you're done reading [[WP:WTA]], head over to [[WP:WEASEL]] and see why this is, again, improper.
NPOV and sourced

/* Background */

Thank you for pointing out that the Hamas article was suffering from a POV issue as well.
This heading and paragraph now conform to the same system used in other articles of the same nature - incl. the Hamas article. This is not POV - it presents both points of view.
rv per [[WP:WTA]]
u r @ ur [[WP:3RR|4 revert]] joebloetheschmo - i'd not block u for that as it's ur 1st offense - pls discuss at talk and stop warring
/* Terror Attacks */ inserted POV tag
It is ridiculous to simply dismiss a title that is completely suitable to the contect by saying that it falls within a larger category that you have specified.
"Militant actions" is more neutral term for the title (terror attacks are special cases of militant attacks anyway).
The killing of Israeli soldiers inside Lebanon is not mentioned here for a reason - they are not terrorist attacks. But, undeniably, the attacks outlined here are defined as terrorist attacks.
/* Terror Attacks */ Ok, I've rewritten it in a NPOV way, leaving all the facts in. But it is POV to call all of them terror attacks.
"POV" is not a rebuttal to every argument - I provided sources and references and there are many many more available. If you have proof that contradicts my souces please provide it.
It is extremely POV to present the opinion of the US and Argentina as facts.
Proof: nearly all western government consider Hezbollah responsible for these acts - especially the US, Argentine governments - and the rocket attacks are completely and utterly indisputable.
Revert POV. There is no proof that ezbollah was behind these terror attacks. Also, it is POV to call the attack on US marines to be a terror attack.
/* Military activities */ no section detailing as part of their activities terrorism - when they have intentionally killed hundreds (including civilians) - there has to be a section here.
Don't need to link to Lebanon 3x in the lead.
Revert propaganda in the lead. It is true that many people in the west believe this propaganda. But propaganda and facts are no the same thing. Let's stick to the facts.
Revert from sanatized lead. The defining facts are not restricted to what Hezbollah does not deny.
Revert POV in the lead. Yes, the POV is sourced and factual, and must be mentioned in the article. But in the lead we should stick to the defining facts about Hezbollah and avoid facts about opinions
